channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Trump-Epstein statue is back on the National Mall, days after its abrupt removal
item.description: The statue honors Trump's "long-lasting bond" with Epstein, which the president denies. The National Park Service took down the statue after one day l...

item.title: Supreme Court to hear challenge to Hawaii's limits on guns
item.description: At issue is the state law that bans guns on private property that is open to the public — places like clubs, bars and restaurants — unless the propert...

item.title: Shutdown has already delayed the jobs report. More critical reports could be held up
item.description: The government's monthly jobs report was not published Friday as a result of the federal shutdown. That's left businesses and policymakers in the dark...

item.title: Sean Combs sentenced to over four years in prison for prostitution-related charges
item.description: Combs had been convicted in July on two counts of transportation for prostitution. During his sentencing hearing he spoke at length for the first time...

item.title: Hamas says it accepts some elements of Gaza peace plan after Trump issues ultimatum
item.description: Hamas said it has accepted some elements of President Trump's plan, including giving up power and releasing all remaining hostages, but that others re...

item.title: Trump pauses $2.1B for Chicago infrastructure projects, leveraging shutdown to pressure Democrats
The only protester still locked up after Trump’s campus crackdown breaks silence: ‘I feel helpless’
Conservative church group condemns choice of female Archbishop of Canterbury
item.description: The group, Gafcon, says that its followers believe "the Bible requires a male-only episcopacy".

item.title: Massive fire at Chevron refinery in California contained, officials say
item.description: The cause of the explosion and blaze at the El Segundo refinery, Chevron's second largest in the US, remains under investigation.

item.title: How to buy gold and silver
item.description: If you're looking to add gold and silver as assets to your portfolio, there are a few ways to get started.

item.title: Four killed in latest US strike on alleged drug vessel near Venezuela
item.description: Donald Trump says the boat was carrying enough drugs to kill thousands of people.

item.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs sentenced to over 4 years for prostitution-related charges
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs' sentencing hearing was held three months after he was convicted ​on two prostitution-related charges.

item.title: Hamas says it agrees to release Israeli hostages but seeks changes to US Gaza peace plan
item.description: The 20-point proposal seeks to end the fighting immediately in return for the release of hostages and detained Gazans.

item.title: 8-year sentence for plot to kill Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh
item.description: Sophie Roske, who was charged under a male name, pleaded guilty in April to attempting to kill or kidnap a Supreme Court justice.

item.title: Behind the Gen Z protesters who want to force Madagascar's president from power
item.description: President Rajoelina's move fails to quell the protest movement that is now threatening his own position.

item.title: U.S. to offer migrant teens $2,500 if they voluntarily leave the country
item.description: The U.S. government is planning to give migrant teenagers a $2,500 stipend if they choose to return to their home countries voluntarily.

item.title: Hamas says it has agreed to parts of the Gaza peace proposal outlined by Trump
item.description: The plan called for Hamas to return all Israeli hostages and for the Israeli military to begin withdrawing from parts of the Gaza Strip in phases.

item.title: Government funding vote fails again in Senate as hopes fade for quick end to shutdown
item.description: Hopes for a quick end to the government shutdown are fading. Democrats have refused to budge in a Senate vote.
